inn1.comm: starts with a length ball on the pads, Nicol works it down to fine leg for a single to get New Zealand underway
outside off and that is goes past the outside edge, 130kph, not much movement there
pitched up, 133kph, seems to have got a little bit of extra bounce to take Guptill by surprise, Guptill takes the bottom hand off the bat and defends it to the off side
nice carry through to the keeper, starts well outside off though so no worries for the batsman
length ball is solidly defended off the front foot towards the covers, 'Wait on,' shouts Guptill
pushed off the front foot towards extra cover for a single to end the over
starts with a leg-side wide

talk about immediate impact! length ball jags away and Guptill pokes at it outside off without moving his feet, gets the outside edge and through to Sammy at second slip, taken low and to his right, Guptill is gone for 1
pitches this up, and outside off, left alone by Flynn
once more in the corridor outside off, another leave
a touch wider, and that is enough for Flynn to flings his bat at it, again not moving his feet at all, doesn't connect and the ball goes through to the keeper
pitched up once more, keeps it close to off stump, shoulders arms
way down the leg side, Russell puts up his hand in apology to his fielders
full and on off stump, blocked diffidently from the crease by Flynn, only runs in that over were the two wides
solid defence towards cover off the front foot
keeps it tight around off, blocked towards backward point
short of length and well outside off, Nicol is happy to allow it to the keeper
same length, just outside off, blocked from the crease towards cover

chance of a run-out there as New Zealand look to pinch a single, Nicol pokes the ball towards cover, Simmons races in towards the ball picks it up but doesn't release it as he sees Flynn dive towards safety
more off side defence to end the over

Russell gets the outside edge once more, doesn't carry to Sammy this time, Nicol would have gone is the same fashion as his opening partner Guptill, Russell getting the ball to swerve away from the batsman
Nicol shuffles down the track before Russell bowls, trying to negate the movement Russell is getting, defends this one
good bounce there for Russell, that starts too wide outside off for Nicol to leave
shuffles down the track and eases that through cover, it's a tactic Nicol has decided to use to counter the away movement of Russell
sprays that down the leg side for his third wide of the day
short of length and just outside off, 136kph, blocked off the back foot towards point
same length, much closer to the stumps, Nicol perhaps expecting that to move away as usual, comes on with the angle instead cramping up Nicol, who awkwardly blocks it down the pitch
pitched up and just outside off, punched through covers by Flynn, not all the way to the boundary but that will give him some confidence
Rampaul probing away at that off stump, blocked from the crease to the off side
the first boundary of the day, Nicol walks down the track and slashes that slightly wide delivery, sends that well over point for four
stays in the crease this time, defended towards point by Nicol
length ball on off stump, patted back towards the bowler, 139kph that one from Rampaul
shortish and just outside off, blocked from the crease to the off side
another wide from Russell, this time for height, well over Flynn's head
getting that to climb from back of a length, Flynn blocks that from the crease, hits high on the bat, 134kph
pitched up and just outside off, Russell around 134kph this over, solid defence
short of length and outside off, Flynn thinks it is full enough to play off the front foot, is beaten as he throws his bat at it
no footwork at all from Flynn as he chases that wide delivery, once more he doesn't connect, Flynn needs to compose himself a bit here
length ball around off, blocked to the off side from the crease

that should give him plenty of confidence, short of length and that is played with a straight bat down the ground, a lofted drive between the bowler and mid-off fetches him a boundary, more of the straight bat will serve him well here
ion middle and leg, defended by Nicol, who has looked solid so far
hello, hello, intent from Nicol, jumps down the track once more and launches that one over mid-on for four more, confident hit by Nicol
just outside off, defended from the crease towards point
much fuller from Rampaul, a mistimed straight drive after shuffling across the stumps, pushed towards mid-on where Pollard fields
on off stump, once more Nicol moves across a bit and tucks the ball  towards square leg, calls 'Yes, yes,' and takes the single
short of length 138kph ball, Flynn fortunate there as he went for the pull, badly mistimed and that loops towards midwicket but between two of the fielders in the ring on the leg side
Flynn attempts the pull again, executes the shot with much more authority this time, swivels as he sends that wide of mid-on for a boundary

oh dear! just after that audacious shot, Flynn looks to crash a length ball through the covers, inside-edges on to the stumps, perhaps that ball moved in a touch and Flynn didn't adjust for that, his wait for an ODI half-century continues, that average does not make good reading, Russell gets his second wicket
greeted with a short ball outside off first up, 136 kph and Williamson is content to sway out of the line of that
back of a length ball heading for off stump, solidly defended to the off side by Kane W
slants this in towards the pads, squeezed out towards the leg side
short of length ball, 134kph, just outside off, mistimes his stroke towards short cover
short of length ball just outside off, confidently blocked towards cover from the crease
nasty bounce there for Nicol, he was caught on the crease, that hit almost the top of the handle as he gets the behind square leg
dropped to the off side, Williamson wanted one and took a couple of steps forward, Nicol's loud shout of 'No,' sends him back, good call too
this one nips in, and bounces, Williamson confident enough to leave it through to the keeper
blocked to the off side by Williamson
both feet off the ground as he chops that towards deep backward point, a fumble in the deep allows the extra run
good bowling from Russell, keeps it around the off stump, no room for Nicol, defended down the track

another down for New Zealand, and another for Russell, Nicol so far has chosen which ball to hit judiciously, this time he charges down the track and though it is a short ball, he looks to power it towards midwicket, top edges towards deep square leg, the fielder awaits, and the fears about New Zealand's batting are being realised
short of length, just outside off, punched through covers for a couple
Russell surprised him with a yorker, 135kph, good thinking that from Russell, Williamson gets his toes out of the way and the bat down in time, he survives
length ball outside off, Williamson opens the face guides it past third slip for a single
shortish ball just outside off, good delivery to the new batsman, who ducks and weaves out of the line
pitched up and that is tucked to short leg
'catch it,' is the call as Williamson works that past short leg
spins in towards off, worked off the back foot towards backward squarel eg
off the outside edge this time, outside edge as Williamson looked to play it to the leg side, the ball rolls towards point
overpitched and that is blocked back to the bowler
big turn there, the offbreak spin in from well outside off, stays low as well and strikes Brownlie on the pads, that was going to miss leg easily, inside-edge as well
short ball and he hooks that towards deep square leg
pitched up this time, heading for off stump, punched towards mid-on
nice tight line from Russell, giving absolutely no room for the batsman, defended down the track
this one moves away a hint after pitching outside off, left alone
outside off, and that is mistimed towards covers
length ball, gives the batsman some width, pushed towards deep point for a single
on the pads, worked towards square leg for a quick single
offspinner, turns a long way again, struck on the pad outside off as he looks to defend
blocked to the leg side
this one moves away a bit, defended
offspinner this time, turns towards the pads, tapped towards backward square leg
more defence to end a quiet over, Brownlie now 0 off 8, not that much of a concern though as NZ's top order has flopped
short ball from DJ Bravo is authoritatively pulled away by Williamson, 128kph, sat up for KW, who dispatches it behind square leg
not the greatest of deliveries that from Bravo, short and wide outside off, KW chases it and misses, quite close to being called a wide
much better length, fuller and angling in towards middle, defended to the leg side
pitched up once more, just outside off, blocked down the track by KW
slants in towards the stumps again, length ball is worked towards square leg for a single
shorter and just outside off, slapped towards cover
Narine has the batsman in all sorts of bother, tossed up and spinning in, Brownlie looks to pay that from the crease, inside-edge, not the most convincing
down the leg side
accurate from Narine, length ball spinning in towards off, blocked, but Brownlie not looking confident at all

and Brownlie fails the Narine test, he never looked like passing it, he looked to play that straighter one from the crease, he misses, struck on the pads in front of middle, doesn't take long for the umpire to lift the finger, New Zealand four down, this isn't looking good for them
length ball goes straight on, heading for off stump, Watling defends the first ball
just a little wider, Watling shuffles across and blocks that to the leg side
pitched up, 132 kph, off stump line, leans forward to block
opens up slightly to play out a similar delivery, around middle and off, towards mid on
width available to punch off the back foot, but had the throw from point hit, KW was out, by about one-thirds of the length of the pitch
fullish, angled in, worked square on leg for one
punched to point from the crease
back and across, played out towards mid on
played out to square leg
massive offspinner, pops up, but comfortably over short leg, off thigh pad as well
well forward now to smother a pitched up offspin
straighter one ending on off stump, he shuffles across a long way, drops it onto the crease, not far from the off stump
middle and leg line, played out to short leg
slightly short of a length, angles in past the half-forward push, and strikes him close to the box
pushed out towards point
pitched up, close to off stump, he is playing it from the crease, and dropping it softly towards point
digs it in short, 134 kph, not much bounce, but enough to be ducked underneath
gets hold of the pull, short ball skidding on just outside off, and he hits it in front of square leg, man in the deep puts in a but it goes through
lots of bounce, but widish, and left alone outside off stump
tentatively coming back and across, and pushing in hope, offbreak spins in past the bat, and pops up in the air, too much turn for an appeal
offbreak is fuller now, and he is able to work it softly square on leg
played out towards midwicket from the crease
tossed up now, fullish, pushed down off the front foot to long on
caught deep in the crease, to a length offbreak, manages to stab it away with an angled bat
flatter, fuller, quicker, lunges forward to block
and another blow midships, Williamson is on his haunches because of the pain, the physio comes out, that was an angling delivery heading towards the stumps, past the inside-edge
short of length ball outside off, outside edge towards third man for a single
length ball just outside off, blocked to the off side, ponder over a single before loud calls of 'No, no'
looks to chop that outside off delivery, Watling goes deep in the crease as he plays that, mistimed towards point
just outside off, and that is left alone by Watling
pitched up delivery, 133.4kph, patted back towards the bowler
a hint of flight, fullish and just outside off, defended to the leg side
shorter and that sits up for a pull towards midwicket
spins down the leg side, Samuels bowling around 90kph
length ball outside off, defended to the off side
punched back towards the bowler, there's no Adnan Akmal behind the stumps but my colleague Abhishek Purohit shouts, 'Yourself,' as the bowler fields
more defence from Watling
flicks that towards deep midwicket for a couple
punched towards mid-off by KW
short of length ball just outside off, played with soft hands towards backward point for a quick single
works the ball towards square leg for a single
back of length ball outside off, blocked toward backward point, not much happening for Dwayne Bravo
full and into the pads, supremely timed that one, whipped to deep backward square leg for four
full, flat, fast, defended down the track
worked towards mid-on this time
down the leg side, that is clipped towards deep square leg by Watling
on middle and leg, defended to the leg side
towards deep midwicket for a single to end the over
Sammy is into the attack now, his first ball is worked towards mid-on for a single
batsman shuffles across and taps the ball towards point, wisely decide against the single
guides that down to third man, 'come on,' says the batsman calling for the single

Sammy gets rid of his opposing number, New Zealand have lost their fifth, KW was looking to run that down to third man, opens the face to a gentle straight back of a length delivery, ends up feathering it through to the keeper, disappointing stroke that
Big Jake is greeted by a bouncer, easy to get under that one, though he is 1.98m tall
inside-edge as he gets forward and looks to defend that
spins in from outside off, defended to the leg side
tucks this behind square leg
94 kph and that is too fast for watling, beaten as he looks to push it towards the off side
punched towards cover off the front foot
clipped towards square leg this time, Samuels racing through the over here, can't have taken much more than a minute to send down these five deliveries
nudged towards square leg
length ball angling across, Oram initially thought of defending that but then raised his bat over his head
length ball on the pads, blocked towards cover
short ball doesn't climb too much, Oram drops the wrists and weaves out of the line
short of length ball outside off, Oram doesn't move his feet as he swipes at it, misses that one
length ball outside off, opens the face as he guides that towards backward point

Oram is tired of ducking the short one, he decides to pull that one, connects well enough to clear the man at deep square leg, for a moment it seemed the fielder could get that but it was well clear of the rope
112kph, full and fast as usual from Samuels, defended
thick outside edge towards backward point for a single
length ball on middle and off, defended towards point
pitched up and that is driven towards extra cover

ooh, that was close, Oram defends that one off the front foot, the ball bounces towards the stumps, Oram is aware of where the ball is, as it starts to come down a second time he uses the back of his bat to prod the ball away
more defence to end the over, that took samuels 1min and 55 seconds, despite taking some 20 seconds to change his field for the left-hander
length ball on middle and off, watchful defence to the off side, no movement at all for Sammy
short of length and outside off, looks to swipe that towards midwicket, nowhere near the ball
short of length ball and on off stump, blocked to the off side by Oram
no feet again from Oram as he looks to poke that towards cover, beaten outside off
pitched up and just outside off, Oram camped in the crease, but waited for it and timed it nicely towards sweeper cover
down the leg side, clipped towards square leg for a tight single, Pollard has a sore shoulder so he was wary of diving
looks to paddle sweep that one, slip started moving even before Oram played the shot, looking to block the paddle, Oram misses and is struck on the pads outside off
Simon Doull says 'the less said about that, the better,' as Samuels fires in a 118kph yorker, blocked
nicely timed there, gets well forward and eases that past mid-off for four
pushed towards point for a single, Oram keeps strike
Oram stays on the back foot and punches that behind backward point for a couple
length ball outside off, moves away with the angle, Oram shoulders arms to that
a slow loopy full toss, just below knee high, pushed towards cover for a single
short of length, on off stump, defended towards square leg
short of length and just outside off, pushed towards mid-on off the front foot
length ball just outside off, tapped towards midwicket to end the over
short of length and outside off, stabbed towards backward point
length ball well outside off, Watling shuffles across and looks to nurdle that behind square leg, Pollard's throw strikes Watling, Pollard immediately apologises
length ball on leg stump, Oram shuffles beyond leg stump, pushes the ball towards cover
length ball outside off, guided towards point by Watling
full ball is helped towards midwicket for a single to end another Samuels over
Rampaul starts his new spell with a short of length ball, slapped towards deep square leg
pitched up, blocked to the leg side
short of length and well outside off, crisply driven towards extra cover
stays on the back foot, guided down to third man for a single
137.1kph effort ball from Rampaul, it leaves Oram as he looks to drive on the up, beaten as the ball sneaks past the outside edge
short of length ball on leg stump, watchful defence down the track
95.7 kph from Samuels, blocked back to the bowler
defended to the leg side this time
length ball outside off, pushed towards cover by Oram for a single, again no feet from the batsman
length ball outside off, pushed towards the bowler, another quick Samuels over coming to an end
length ball well outside off, misses as he looks to play that through the off
spins in towards the stump after pitching outside off, inside edge towards square leg, Oram is happy to get to the safety of the non-striker's end
short of length ball outside off, went straight on, punched towards mid-on
short ball, offspinner, Oram waits on the backfoot, pulls it towards long-on
flighted, fuller and spins it towards off, driven for another single
on middle stump, Oram moves across and tucks it behind square leg
inside-edge onto the pads, after Oram shuffles beyond leg stump, Narine has overstepped
free-hit is punished by Oram, stays in the crease and powers that over long-on for six, Narine's figures are still respectable, but no longer outstanding
looks to power that towards mid-on, not the best timed shot
length ball outside off, Oram skips beyond leg stump and pushes the ball towards mid-off for a single
length ball on off, whipped towards deep square leg by Watling
bowler follows Oram who was backing away from the stumps, doesn't work though as Oram times that full ball on the pads towards midwicket for four, nicely done
late adjustment there by Oram, initially seemed to be looking for a horizontal bat shot and then defends that shortish ball with an angled bat
slightly slower from Rampaul, 123kph, Oram looking to send that into orbit, that sneaks under his bat, and past the back pad to crash into leg stump, end of a fighting stand
flighted offspinner, spinning in towards the stumps, just gets the inside edge, nearly sneaked through, Watling lucky there

Referral, that one spins sharply after pitching outside off, Watling looked to play that off the back foot, hits him high on the back pad, umpire gives it out, replays suggest that ball was going to miss the bails, the height saves Watling, though am not too sure that was going as high as the simulation suggests
on off stump, Watling stays in the crease and tucks it towards midwicket
punched towards mid-off for a single, Ellis off the mark and off the strike
spins a long way again, turns past the pads, flicked behind square leg for a couple
bouncer outside off, Ellis keeps his hands low and sways out of the line of that one
shortish again, on middle and off, tucked towards square leg
short of length ball heading for off stump, steered towards backward point
eased down towards long-on for a single, that was a pitched up delivery on off stump
shortish once more, outside off, pulled towards deep backward square leg
aiming for the yorker, slants it down the leg side, that'll be a wide
gets the yorker right this time, 138kph and has the batsman in a bit of bother, Watling hurriedly gets his toes out of danger and jams his bat on that delivery
length ball well outside off, blocked off the front foot
spins away this time, Ellis shuffles across the stumps and defends
a mild appeal for lbw as Ellis looks to defend, the ball spins too much for his liking, it turns past his bat and hits the pads, just outside of
solidly blocked to the off side
short ball and wide outside off, Ellis waits on the back foot and defends to the off side
big turn for Narine, off the thigh pad to the keeper
short of length and just outside off, whipped towards backward square leg, Ellis is certainly happier facing Sammy than Narine
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended towards mid-off
length ball on off stump, defended to the leg side
length ball, sticking to an off stump line, pushed towards midwicket, in the air for a bit
short of length and heading for middle and off, punched towards long-on
length ball again, worked to the leg side for one more
length ball from Russell, tucked towards deep backward square leg
pitched up once more, no room on offer once more, tapped to midwicket
sprays that way down the leg side, Ramdin does well to get a glove on it and prevent any byes
short of length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler, all pretty quiet here
shortish on leg stump, helped towards deep backward square leg
shortish again, pulled to deep square leg for one more
short and wide, eased towards sweeper cover for one more, New Zealand 133 for 6 in 40 overs
a full toss to start, thumped down to long-on, Sammy will be happy that gentle delivery wasn't taken for more
pushed towards midwicket this time
short of length and outside off, pulled towards deep square leg
short of length and heading for off, 127kph, helped along to the deep backward square leg, and there is an overthrow as the throw from the deep yorks the keeper
length ball eased towards long-on, this has a mid-innings tempo more than a last ten overs feel, New Zealand aren't sure when they should start going for their shots, given that six wickets are down
another risk-free single towards mid-on to end the over
fuller and on the pads, that is punished, gets forwards and thumps that towards the wide long-on boundary, New Zealand need a few more of those
shortish ball down the leg side, the wide count rises for Russell

huge appeal for lbw, but looked to have struck the pads outside off, referral as the umpire turns it down, that short of length ball stayed a touch low as he looked to work it to the leg side, struck on the pads, and the replays show it did hit him just outside off, it was a close call that
length ball is pushed towards mid-on for a scampered single
struck on the pads once more but this time the full ball was sliding down the leg side, batsman was looking to whip that to the leg side but misses
length ball is pushed back towards the bowler, West Indies not giving away too many boundaries towards the end of this innings
short of length and outside off, flat-batted towards long-on for a single
starts with a ball outside off that is slapped towards point
skips beyond leg stump and Bravo sends that wide outside off, batsman has to quickly move across to try reach that, he can't
length ball on the stumps, played slightly uppishly to the right of the bowler, no pace in the ball at all, Bravo tries to dive but that ball was too far even for him
fuller ball, just outside off, down to long-off for a single
slides down the leg side, another wide and New Zealand's 150 is up
slower ball, 109kph, full and outside off, a wristy stroke sends that to deep square leg
Ellis takes a big stride away from the stumps a she looks to make room, Bravo bowls that on off, crunched towards cover, doesn't place it properly, so that's a dot ball
a boundary at last, and not the prettiest of ways to get it , a shortish ball outside off, Watling looks to pull and top-edges that over the keeper for four
full ball is whipped towards deep midwicket for a single
Ellis again walks away from the stumps, Russell isn't flustered by that big movement, he hurls in a middle stump yorker, squeezed out by Ellis
full ball outside off, punched to long-on for a single to bring uo Watling's half-century, was not a particularly quick innings, but just what New Zealand needed after the top order crumbled
a low full toss following the batsman, thumped down the ground for a single
full ball outside off, muscled towards extra cover for one more
length ball outside off is swept towards deep square leg

Narine strikes on his second delivery, once more Ellis moves a bit away from leg stump, not the dramatic step away but a more small one, it was an offspinner from Narine, Ellis looked to cut that, he misses and the ball hit the top of middle
spins in from a length, struck on the thigh pad
length ball is played off the back foot towards extra cover
length ball is pushed back to Narine
flighted offspinner, looks to defend off the front foot, gloved onto the pad
starts the over with a yorker just outside off, dug out back towards the bowler
full and outside off, not quite yorker length this time, squeezed out towards deep point
low full toss outside off, thumped to long-on for a single
shortish ball outside off, pulled to deep square leg, one more, New Zealand not being able to find the boundaries
bangs in a bouncer outside off, left alone

and he takes his fourth off the final delivery of his quota, not the best of deliveries, it was full and sliding down the leg side, whipped towards short fine leg for a catch, a few yards either side of that fielder and that was four
short of length ball, doesn't turn too much, worked to midwicket for a single
that goes quicker and straight, Southee was looking for the off spin, beaten
no flight this time, darted towards the middle, worked to the leg side for a single
on the pads and towards short fine leg
outside off, looking to defend, inside-edged and that bounces through to the keeper
a boundary to end Narine's quota of 10 overs, Watling goes on to his highest score in ODIs as he sweeps that from outside off past short fine leg
Rampaul starts the over aiming for the blockhole, off the pads for a leg bye, that was sliding down the leg side
full and on middle stump, helped down towards fine leg for a single
overpitched and outside leg, driven towards long-on for a single
a yorker outside off, slapped back to the bowler

referral, a big appeal for lbw is upheld, Watling argues for a review again, that looked plumb and it is plumb, it was a length ball and he looked to thump that towards midwicket, he missed and was struck low on the pads in front of middle, it was the end of the innings, and only No. 11 to come, so Watling decided to punt on the review, doesn't work this time though, he's a goner, end of a important knock for Watling, with several other keepers looking for a place in the NZ side
length ball outside off, driven towards extra cover
slower offcutter, 109kph, looked to push that towards the off side, beaten
slower ball and heading towards off, worked towards mid-on for one more
pitched up and driven towards long-off for a single
short of length ball, delicately played past a diving Rampaul at short third man for four
full and outside off, dug out toward backward point
length ball on off stump, thumped towards midwicket
length ball on middle, drilled towards long-on
swinging yorker, that was heading for middle and off, inside-edged onto the boot
full again, on middle, another run to long-on
length ball is helped along to midwicket, so New Zealand will bat out their full quota of 50 overs
length ball is driven towards long-off, and seemed like the sixth single in a row, but they push for the second and New Zealand finish on 190

inn2.comm: Mills starts with a short of length ball outside off, left alone
short of length ball on off, blocked to the off side
well outside off, shoulders arms
keeps it close to off, more watchful defence
good start this from New Zealand, keeps pegging away around off stump, more blocking
a maiden to begin the innings, well outside off, left alone
the first ball Gayle faces goes for four, but not off the bat, off the thigh pad and past a diving wicketkeeper for four leg-byes
pitching outside leg stump, off the pads and the ball dribbles to the off side, another leg-bye
length ball just outside off, defends towards the off side
wider outside off, gets some away swing but too far outside off to worry Simmons
the ball swerves away once more, Simmons shoulders arms once more
length ball on off stump, defended from the crease to the off side
short ball climbs towards Gayle's shoulder, Gayle stands tall and defends, hits on the handle
pitched up and swinging away from Gayle outside off, 130kph, left alone
pitched up around off stump, thick outside off towards backward point
full and on the pads, pushed towards mid-off for a quick single, not the sort of manner you'd expect Gayle to get his first run
length ball outside off, tucks it towards square leg

Simmons is gone, New Zealand have struck early, that was slanting down the leg side, tickled through to the keeper, who does well to get to his left to catch that, Simmons starts to walk away as he knows he has edged that, the on-field umpire wanted to check for a no-ball, replay suggested Mills had overstepped, I was expecting Simmons to be called back, instead he is sent on his way
defended off the back foot towards cover
back of a length and outside off, blocked to the off side
down the leg side, another extra
pitched up, on the off stump, blocked back to the bowler
short ball on middle and leg, Gayle stays on the back foot and pulled that towards deep backward square leg
more of the Gayle we know, slightly short and that is hammered over the bowler's head for four, the first boundary off the bat this innings
a yorker outside off, squeezed towards the bowler
short ball outside off, smith defends to the leg side
just outside off, edges it but it lands safely short of second slip, Dwayne Smith poked at that one but only got the outside edge
on middle and leg, more defence from Smith
length ball angling into off, defended off the front foot towards the bowler
pushes that towards cover point, that was a short of length ball
New Zealand continue to keep it tight, on middle and leg, tucked to square leg
down the leg side, helped along to fine leg for a boundary
pitched up, crisply driven off the front foot towards mid-off
length ball outside off, Smith is happy to leave it to the keeper
length ball is eased towards mid-off once more
short of length and just outside off, poked towards cover for a single
wonderful, that sends the crowd wild, Gayle at his best, a free swing of the bat, didn't even seem like he wanted to hit that hard, easily clears the long-on boundary, first six for Gayle
short of length ball is defended back to the bowler
short ball outside off, Dwayne Smith is looking to clear the midwicket boundary though there is a fielder in the deep
short ball and he pulls it, this was a controlled effort, keeping the ball on the ground and swivels as he sends that to the deep backward square leg boundary
length ball is pushed towards cover, 'No,' shouts Smith
length ball on middle and off, blocked to the leg side
last ball of the over stayed low, it was well outside off, Smith was looking to drive through cover, but that slips past the inside-edge
starts with a back of length ball outside off, Gayle shoulders arms
short of length and just outside off, defended towards cover
Oram keeping Gayle quiet, that was slanting in towards middle stump, blocked to the off side
Gayle given some width, that's enough for him to slash it past point for four, powerfully hit

unbelievable hitting from Gayle, it really doesn't seem like he is even putting too much effort, that was a short of length ball outside off, Gayle swings and that is way over long-off for six, seemingly effortless
short of length and just outside off, Gayle defends from the crease towards point to end the over
length ball sliding into leg stump, defended by Smith
full ball is punched towards mid-on, dot ball again
length ball outside off is driven off the front foot towards cover

terrific fielding in the deep, not so terrific running by the West Indian batsmen, they only took one after Smith pulled that one towards deep square leg, a diving stop by the deep midwicket fielder stops that one, sorry, they only managed one because Smith collided with Mills while taking the run, smith was watching the ball as he ran
pitched up and outside off, it was in the slot and I half expected that to be smashed down the ground by Gayle, he decides to leave it through to the keeper
length ball is defended towards mid-on for a single
Oram bowling from wide of the crease, round the wicket, angles it towards the pads, tucked behind square leg for a single
over the wicket to the right-hander, length ball is defended to the off side
length ball again, heading for off stump, defended to the bowler
to the inside of the thigh as he looks to work that to the leg side, too high for there to be a serious lbw appeal
blocked towards cover to end the over
pitching outside leg and hits the pads, doesn't stop Nicol from appealing
length ball is driven off the back foot towards the bowler
on the pads, looking to tucks that to the leg side, off the pad towards leg slip
on middle stump, pushed towards mid-off
spins away after pitching on middle, driven towards extra cover for a single
length ball just outside off, 95kph, pushes that towards mid-on
short of length ball heading for off, defended by Smith, who is playing a very controlled hand so far
slants it towards the pads, off the pad and the ball dribbles towards midwicket

there's the big swing to the leg side, you could sense it coming, he doesn't connect too well as he pulls that one, top half of the bat and the ball balloons high, but it carries long enough to cross the deep square leg boundary, Smith gets to 1000 ODI runs with that stroke
blocked off the front foot towards the bowler
short of length ball is driven towards mid-off, take a sharp single

Chris Gayle! skips a couple of steps down the track and dispatches that over long-off, a long way over the rope, sort of a controlled shot that, the catch is taken but in the crowd, Oram must be feeling a bit helpless, as many a bowler has when faced with Gayle
defends the first ball of the over
no footwork as he defends that leg stump delivery
well outside off, forces it past a diving cover fielder, 'catch,' is the call but there was no real chance of that, boundary for Smith
"Anything you can do, I can do as well," says Smith as he swipes that one powerfully from outside off and miles beyond the long-on boundary for six more
outside off and he misses that one
98kmph from Nicol, who has decided flat and fast is the way to go, defended towards mid-on
length ball on off stump, prodded towards point for a single
length ball on middle and leg, pushed to the right of the bowler, Nethula fields
gets a bit of spin here, defended from the crease to the off side
length ball outside off, careful forward defence
googly from Nethula, spins in from outside off, defended towards the off side
spins away from off, guided towards short third man, that's a maiden
length ball on off stump from round the wicket, blocked by Gayle
Gayle down the track but doesn't launch it, pushed towards the bowler

this time he launches it, when he decides to hit them, there's no use of having the fielder in the deep, takes big stride forward and crunches it past the long-on rope, not taken by the crowd either, as several fans scattered on seeing the ball approach
defended off the back foot towards point
drilled towards long-off for a single

Nethula began with a maiden to Smith, but his first ball to Gayle is a four, was a tough chance that for Nethula as Gayle absolutely hammered that back towards the bowler, hits his hands and slows down a bit, just a bit, not slow enough for the diving long-on fielder to stop that reaching the fence
googly outside off, Gayle fishes for that and doesn't connect
defended to the leg side
on the pads, more watchful defence from Gayle
short from Nethula, Gayle gets on the back foot and slaughters that one, some of the oncoming vehicles in the road beyond midwicket had to watch out as the ball streaked towards them
length ball is whipped towards long-on for a single
a yorker outside off, Gayle opens the face to guide the ball to third man for a single, moves to 49
pitched up, defended towards the bowler
pushed off the front foot towards cover
low full toss outside off, turned it to midwicket, a bit of a mishit
steered down to third man for a single
length ball on the pads, defended
just outside off this time, more watchful defence
full toss down the leg side, a freebie, paddled for four past fine leg, Smith didn't go for power there, opting for placement
spun away from a length, slapped towards sweeper cover for a single
full ball outside off, drive towards mid-off, that was hit so hard that there wasn't time to get a single even though the fielder was on the edge of the circle
defended to the left of the bowler, Gayle still on 49
pushed towards covers off the front foot by Smith
defended off the front foot towards the off side by Smith
short of a length ball on off stump, punched towards extra cover for a single
there's Gayle's half-century, a full toss outside off, poked towards point for a single, Gayle lifts his bat and salutes his home crowd
strays on the pads, and that is tucked behind square leg for one more
another full toss, steered towards deep backward square leg
inside edge and towards deep square leg for a single, Gayle was looking to power that length ball down the ground
a boundary for Smith, he thumps that past mid-on for four, that was overpitched and just outside off, not the most elegant of strokes from Smith, he clubbed that
Smith gets on the back foot and looks to chop that one, it was well outside off, but still smith chases it and can't connect
pushed towards midwicket this time, no run
six for Smith, not a bad way of getting to his half-century, launches that over long-on, this innings will do his meagre ODI average some good
nurdled towards deep backward square leg for a single, 20 overs done and that means we will definitely have a result
short of length and wide outside off, punched towards extra cover, a diving stop by Nethula
a bouncer and Gayle ducks under that one
defended by Gayle, stands tall and blocks to the off side with a straight bat
Gayle looks to power this full ball, off the bottom of the bat and the ball trickles to the off side
straight drive by Gayle past Southee, it was a low full toss outside off, mid-off fields and keeps the batsmen to a sharp single
Smith shuffles down the track and that is pushed towards extra cover

guided towards deep backward point, it was a low full toss for Gayle, who scrambles back for the seconfd, Gayle isn't known as someone who is very enthusiastic about running between the wickets, but he has taken a few quicks ones today
full and very wide outside off, wide
driven with brutal power towards long-off, Nathan McCullum cuts that off at long-off, it was a length ball outside off
Oram around the wicket, a full ball is pushed back down the track
Smith mistimes it as he pushes another full delivery back towards the bowler
short ball after those two full ones, that one rears sharply outside off, Smith watches it and swerves out of the line
another full one, outside off, that is drilled towards long-on for a single

dropped by Nicol, smith skied that overpitched ball towards point,  several fielders were converging on that, Nicol called for it, got under it in time, tried to take it with his fingers pointing up with the ball coming over his shoulder, couldn't hang on
a low full toss well outside off, slashed away to the sweeper cover boundary, some of the fans in the crowd also join in signalling the boundary
a yorker on middle stump, squeezed out towards extra cover
on the pads, clipped towards deep midwicket, that was another full toss from Southee
thumps it towards a wide mid-on, it is a full toss again from Southee, a single is taken
Oram continues the trend of full tosses, slightly high this one, just above the knee roll and that is turned towards square leg
a slower one from Oram, helped towards deep square leg for a single
another boundary, West Indies finishing this in a hurry, that was a full ball on the pads, whipped to the deep backward square leg boundary for four
again on the pads, again Smith clips it, just a single this time as the deep square leg fielder stops it
angling down the leg side, helped to the right of the keeper, who moves quickly across and takes off a glove and underarms the ball towards the stumps
works it away towards short midwicket for a single, that was a full ball well outside off stump, Smith mistimes his drive
well outside off, smith wanted to send that out of the ground, doesn't connect
this time he does, and he sends that to the deep point boundary, a full and wide ball, an utterly one-sided game this, would have been a travesty if New Zealand escaped because of the rain
